title: Majority of electorate does not vote

content.question: Considering all elections at all levels of government, which of the following best describes electoral behavior in the United States?

choices.label: Primary elections tend to elicit a higher voter turnout than do general elections.
The majority of the electorate does not vote in most elections.
Voter turnout plays an insignificant role in election outcomes.
Adult citizens under the age of 30 tend to have the highest rate of voter turnout.
Voters with strong party identification vote less regularly than do independents.

content.answer: The majority of the electorate does not vote in most elections.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
